creator: stevestk@yahoo.com
text:
When starting Apache I receive the following error: Syntax error on line 53 
of /www_exp/src/mac/conf/httpd.conf:
Cannot load /www/opt/httpd-2.0.58/modules/libphp5.sl into server: No such file 
or directory. It is a false error msg as I will explain below. The problem 
occurs when I attempt to add support for Sybase to PHP which is being added as 
a DSO. I have tried Apache 2.2.3 and 2.0.58 and both get the error. Apache 
1.3.37 works fine.

Apache Build:
./configure --prefix=/www/opt/httpd-2.2.3_ph --enable-so
make
make install

PHP Build:
./configure' \
'--prefix=/www/opt/php-5.1.4' \
'--with-apxs2=/www/opt/httpd-2.2.3_ph/bin/apxs' \
'--with-sybase-ct=/dbms/sybase/OCS-12_5' \
'--with-libxml-dir=/www/opt/libxml2-2.6.26' 

If I remove Sybase from the build, the same library is built in  the same 
location and Apache starts fine. I can also add other options to the PHP 
build, such as Mysql with no problem. When I build PHP with Sybase, I am also 
able to access Sybase via the sapi/cli/php executable which is also created by 
make.

This sounds like some issue with the Sybase support in PHP or some missing
shared library etc.  Please try a PHP user support forum.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
stevestk@yahoo.com
text:
I considered it could be a sybase/php issue. But any idea why it would work with
Apache 1.3? Also is there any way to get more diagnostic info out of Apache?

Those may be interesting questions.  But they are user-support questions, not a
report of a bug in the Apache HTTP Server.  Hence Joe's suggestion to visit a
user-support forum is your best bet.
creator: slive@apache.org
